content: I'm curious if any rustdoccers are planning to be at rustconf 2022 (August 3-5, Portland OR, USA). I generally don't travel for conferences, but since this one is in my hometown I figured I'd go.
ooh now I'm tempted to give a talk on bootstrapping

Joshua Nelson said:

ooh now I'm tempted to give a talk on bootstrapping

Please do! I'd love to see a proposal about that.
I don't intend to (generally I avoid going to the US, this country is very scary).

@Josh Triplett anything in particular you're interested in? I was imagining something like

  • What is bootstrapping / what special build needs does the compiler have (basically a summary of https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/building/bootstrapping.html#bootstrapping-the-compiler). Maybe briefly explain why it can't just use cargo.
  • History of bootstrap, which also includes some fun project history like the ocaml compiler and makefiles :)
  • Some examples of high effort / high reward changes, like download-rustc and download-ci-llvm and how they work
Ooh I'll probably mention trusting trust and mrustc too
(rewrite is probably stretching it, but happy to mention moving things out of bootstrap)
